name: D.H._Lawrence
text:
D.H. Lawrence
D.H. Lawrence was a poet.
On April 23, 1970, April Larken read Lawrence's poem, "Gloire de Dijon" to an English class she was student teaching at the Germantown Friends School.
Behind the scenes
David Herbert Lawrence (September 11, 1885 – March 2, 1930) was an English writer and poet best known for his works focusing on sexuality, emotional health, vitality, spontaneity, and instinct.
